data.title: Nourishing community for the heart and mind
data.meta_description: Nourishing community for the heart and mind
data.text:
If you can’t make the 10 am in-person Sunday worship, you can find a recording of the worship online by early afternoon on our church Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/First-English-Lutheran-Church-186337218340/ or on YouTube.com at “First English Lutheran Church Baltimore MD” channel https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCNBLjZGrKTrp6X6NBsPhgYA

Barclay has asked for school item donations for students who don’t have the resources to get them themselves. The basics are needed: backpacks, composition notebooks, pink erasers, #2 pencils, pens, highlighters, index cards, binder, post-it notes, notebook paper, 2 pocket folder, ziplock bags, antibacterial wipes, crayons, colored pencils, glue sticks, glue bottles, pencil case, scissors,…

On God’s Work Our Hands Sunday (Sept. 8) we will be assembling Lutheran World Relief baby care kits. We still need a few items: dark hand towels, cloth (flat fold) diapers, baby receiving blankets, and baby socks. Bring these items to church through Sept. 1. Then join us on Sept. 8 when the New Orleans…

We are preparing for our 200th anniversary cookbook by accepting recipes now! Click on the “Activities” tab on this website to find the place to upload your recipe AND the story behind that recipe. (Why is it important to you? Who gave it to you? We want to know.) We plan to release the cookbook…

(through 2024) Julie Enger (Vice-President), Matthew Treskon (President), Marya Zeigler (through 2025) Dobie Elliott, Mike Olmstead, Jeanie Powers (through 2026) Laurel Bassett (Secretary), Paul Christensen, Tim Smith

Click on the “Giving” tab on this website and put the amount you want to give in the “Capital Fund” area. The 2022-2025 Capital Campaign is a way for First English to do some much-needed repairs to the church roof, mortar, heating system, and accessibility.
